alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Southern Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL SPARTANBURG... SOUTHWESTERN CHEROKEE AND NORTHWESTERN UNION COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 510 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Spartanburg, or near Pacolet, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gaffney, Pacolet, Jonesville, Pacolet Mills, Croft State Park, Cedar Springs, and Thicketty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
